body.name: Coats Triple Moisture Water Face Cream. Water Based Moisturizer for Face with Hyaluronic Acid + Ceramides + Vitamin E. Hydrating Face Moisturizer for Women and Men - Combination to Dry Skin (75ml)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 16. Order within 8 hrs
features: DERMATOLOGICALLY APPROVED FACIAL MOISTURIZER - skin care for dry and combination skin. Lightweight, non-comedogenic face cream for women and men that gives intensive hydration, suitable for use as a day or night cream

ALL DAY HYDRATION – face moisturizer for men and women powered by Polyglutamic Acid, that holds 4 x the amount of water as Hyaluronic Acid, for instant skin hydration without stickiness. Feels invisible on the skin

SKIN BARRIER PROTECTING CERAMIDES - supercharged skincare with complex of Ceramides and Signal Tripeptides, clinically proven face lotion to help strengthen and protect your skin’s natural moisture barrier all day
POLLUTION PROTECTION - infused with Vitamin E and Signal Tripeptides, this moisturizer face cream protects the skin from environmental aggressors

100% VEGAN and CRUELTY FREE - kind to both your skin and the planet, this cruelty-free facial cream is made of the highest-quality vegan ingredients, is alcohol-free and fragrance-free, with packaging made from recycled materials, and is carbon neutral
body.description: Coats Triple Moisture Water Cream For all-day hydration and dewy, bouncy skin that never feels greasy. This face cream is a super lightweight, non-comedogenic, water-based moisturizer with a triple dose of hydrating actives: Polyglutamic Acid, Ceramides, and Squalene. Our uniquely balanced face moisturizer gives all-day hydration and protects the skin barrier.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Clean ingredients never breaks me out always the moisturizer that I go back to

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Like CeraVe, but nicer
reviews.reviewText: Firstly, A little about me: i have very finicky skin and deal with rosacea and some breakouts. finding a moisturizer that is lightweight and nourishing is surprisingly hard. gel creams tend to do little, and creams feel stuffy and break me out.This is a perfect in-between. It does have that water cream feel to it, but it spreads well and has some oomph to it. i appreciate the very slight cooling sensation as well. no irritation, dryness, or additional redness here either. If you’re very dry, this probably wouldn’t be enough during fall or winter but other than that i could see this working well for most people. It’s a pretty big tube (2.5oz) for $25, so i’d say it’s similar in value to a $15 moisturizer that has 1.7oz. I’ve had it for about 1 1/2 months and barely made a dent in it. definitely worth it, i’d say. I’m interested enough to try the toner at some point too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good hydrating product for oily/normal combo skin
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this since my favorite moisturizer hydro boost water gel is $20 for only 1.7 fl oz. This one is around the same price for 2.5 fl oz, which is a better deal to me. It feels slightly heavier and creamier than the hydro boost, but it is still nice. It doesn’t really have a scent at all. I have oily/normal combo skin and it does well. I also have acne prone skin, and I haven’t noticed this worsening at all. I feel that is hydrates well. I still love the texture and “water” feel of the hydro boost the best. But this is probably the second best moisturizer I’ve tried. it is not sticky at all and dries down nice and soft. If you need something slight heavier than hydro boost but not by much more, this is a good product for this. For reference I am very picky about texture of moisturizers and HATE heavy creamy textures that feel like lotion. This barely has a “lotion” feel to it. I don’t think it would be great for drier skin, but maybe for combo oily/dry.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not super long lasting
reviews.reviewText: I bought this in september and i have pretty dry skin on my cheek area. I bought this because I thought it would not clog pores. I think it succeeded in the non-clogging part but the moisture only lasts for a little bit before my skin looks dry again. Might be okay for summer but definitely don't reccommend for winter dryness. I dont think I would repurchase

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bump prone skin
reviews.reviewText: If you have bump prone skin or oily this moisturizer is great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not moisturizing enough.
reviews.reviewText: The moisturizer feels good on your skin and it leaves your skin looking good after you put it on but after less than an hour my skin feels tight and dry.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I have dry, acne prone, sensitive skin.
reviews.reviewText: Cost: I gave this product 4-stars because you pay $25 for a very tiny bottle (2.5 fl oz.). Tube feels full to the max which is nice, but I’d prefer an option to buy a much bigger tube as this would go fast if using AM and PM. I only use AM, but this still isn’t a tube that’s going to last very long for a dry skin gal.Other than the price, I love the product. This is a very clean product and very friendly for us acne prone (I have hormonal acne as well), dry skin, sensitive, red faced prone gals! I have tried soooo many lotions, creams, and gels, and I really feel hydrated and like the way my skin looks with this product. Currently I’m just using the lotion and haven’t started using the face wash yet, but am excited to see results with both products together since both hydrate the skin.Even with the price tag, I will continue to use because I feel clean, safe, and happy with the product. My skin is showing the benefits of the product for sure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars not worth it
reviews.reviewText: real expensive for a moisturizer that did nothing

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: not oil !!! Light and doesn't clog the skin as so many o il based products do
reviews.reviewText: I love this. Oil free it doesn't cause break outs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Very hydrating, and it gets rapidly absorbed in the skin
reviews.reviewText: I've got dry to mixed skin, this is very hydrating, it gets rapidly absorbed in the skin. Been using it for a few days only, but I already find it very useful, particularly for the colder season.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Good product for hydration and if you are looking for a light weight moisturiser.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 27, 2023
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have subtype 2 rosacea (diagnosed by an NHS dermatologist) and have struggled to find a moisturiser that is hydrating enough to soothe redness whilst at the same time being oil free and non-comedogenic. This product satisfies these criteria and is something of a miracle cream. All of my symptoms: redness, dryness, and blemishes have reduced since I started using this product.The consistency is somewhere between a serum and lotion. A small blob is enough for my whole face and neck. It takes about ten minutes to fully absorb after application and leaves no visible trace. After about an hour the reduction in redness is clear. Skin feels soft and natural all day.The ingredients are: Aqua, dicaprylyl ether, propanediol, caprylic/capric triglyceride, butylene glycol, squalane, phenoxyethanol, sodium polyacrylate, benzyl alcohol, dicaprylyl carbonate, carbomer, sodium hydroxide, xanthan gum, disodium EDTA, sodium lauroyl lactylate, sodium polyglutamate, polyglyceryl-3 caprate, sorbitan trioleate, ceramide np, ceramide ap, phytosphingosine, cholesterol, ethylhexylglycerin, myristoyl tripeptide-31, tocopherol, ceramide eop.I would recommend this product alongside Cetaphil's gentle cleanser, twice per day. I have also gotten good results from Dermatica's azelaic acid cream. Hope this review is helpful for other rosacea sufferers.
